body: Yeah, ask me stuff, will probably reply within 24 hours.

And use complete sentences.

replies.body: Do you like Football? And I'm not talking about Soccer either.
replies.body_tagged: Do you like Football? And I'm not talking about Soccer either.

replies.body: Does your mouse work okay?
replies.body_tagged: Does your mouse work okay?

replies.body:
Does your mouse work okay?
Mostly- it's cord broke about half way through last year, which is unfortunate because logitech products are high end and the chances of a malfunction are low. I did not have a receipt, so I couldn't take it back to the store I bought it from, I could've contacted Logitech because they have amazing customer support, but didn't particularly feel like it so instead bought a soldering iron.

I got a cord from another Logitech mouse, opened up my mouse, cut the cord on both mice and soldered the respective wires inside each together. This fixed the problem of the broken cord, but then sprouted the problem of me accidentally breaking a ribbon cable that connects to the three thumb buttons on my mouse, and accidentally using the wrong sized screw driver and wearing down 3 of the main screws on the mouse. Problem now is that I have A) no functioning thumb buttons, but the side buttons next to my left click work fine and I use those for dpi changing, and B) the base of my mouse at the front occasionally separates from the top due to the lack of screws, which makes clicking harder but is easy to fix, by simply pressing them together and only happens once a month or so. I also removed the teflon feet during repairs and havn't yet replaced them but they dont reall impact much other than getting the occasional hair in the sensor. Here's a pic of the bottom of the mouse.
replies.body_tagged:

Mostly- it's cord broke about half way through last year, which is unfortunate because logitech products are high end and the chances of a malfunction are low. I did not have a receipt, so I couldn't take it back to the store I bought it from, I could've contacted Logitech because they have amazing customer support, but didn't particularly feel like it so instead bought a soldering iron.

I got a cord from another Logitech mouse, opened up my mouse, cut the cord on both mice and soldered the respective wires inside each together. This fixed the problem of the broken cord, but then sprouted the problem of me accidentally breaking a ribbon cable that connects to the three thumb buttons on my mouse, and accidentally using the wrong sized screw driver and wearing down 3 of the main screws on the mouse. Problem now is that I have A) no functioning thumb buttons, but the side buttons next to my left click work fine and I use those for dpi changing, and B) the base of my mouse at the front occasionally separates from the top due to the lack of screws, which makes clicking harder but is easy to fix, by simply pressing them together and only happens once a month or so. I also removed the teflon feet during repairs and havn't yet replaced them but they dont reall impact much other than getting the occasional hair in the sensor. Here's a pic of the bottom of the mouse.

replies.body:
Do you like Football? And I'm not talking about Soccer either.
American football, Aussie rules, Rugby league?
I don't have a large interest in any sports in terms of watching it but if i had to choose one, I'd choose Australian Football League.
Don't like playing any form of football either.

On a scale of 1 to 10 whats your favorite colour of the alphabet? :D
Yes.

What does the sound of the color 9 smell like? 
It would smell like whatever the air in the rooms of which the vibrations are moving through is made up of.

Do you detonate?
I do not detonate myself, but I do tend to detonate things, yes.

Why did you retire?
Certain incompatibilities between myself and the current staff team.

Are you my lost son?
Can't imagine so.

replies.body:
Sweet or Savoury?
Depends on the time of the day. Right now I could really go for something sweet.

Will you play on OCN?
I've been playing there for over a year.

Will you ever come back?
Unlikely.

Presumably neural signals within my brain.

replies.body: Of all the people close to you (family, friends, SOs, etc), whose death would you find most disturbing? Why?
replies.body_tagged: Of all the people close to you (family, friends, SOs, etc), whose death would you find most disturbing? Why?

replies.body: Probably anyone on the internet that were to die suddenly. The fact that they one day might stop responding without any explanation is disturbing to me.
replies.body_tagged: Probably anyone on the internet that were to die suddenly. The fact that they one day might stop responding without any explanation is disturbing to me.
